content:
TITLE: Implementing Correlation Context in SkyWalking Go DESCRIPTION: A complete Go application example demonstrating how to set and retrieve correlation values between spans. The example shows a consumer and provider handler with HTTP communication where correlation values are passed between services. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2023-10-18-skywalking-toolkit-trace/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` package main import ( _ "github.com/apache/skywalking-go" "github.com/apache/skywalking-go/toolkit/trace" "net/http" ) func providerHandler(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) { ctxValue := trace.GetCorrelation("key") trace.SetTag("result", ctxValue) } func consumerHandler(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) { trace.SetCorrelation("key", "value") _, err := http.Get("http://localhost:9999/provider") if err != nil { return } } func main() { http.HandleFunc("/provider", providerHandler) http.HandleFunc("/consumer", consumerHandler) _ = http.ListenAndServe(":9999", nil) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: PromQL Query for Service Apdex Score in Grafana Panel DESCRIPTION: Query used in a Grafana time series panel to visualize Service Apdex score. The result is divided by 10000 to match the expected units. This panel uses common value metrics from SkyWalking. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2023-03-17-build-grafana-dashboards-for-apache-skywalking-native-promql-support/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` service_apdex{service='$service', layer='$layer'} / 10000 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Bootstrap Starter Template DESCRIPTION: This snippet provides a complete HTML5 starter template for a Bootstrap-enabled webpage, including necessary meta tags, CSS, and JavaScript inclusions. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/themes/docsy/assets/vendor/bootstrap/site/docs/4.1/getting-started/introduction.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` Hello, world!

Hello, world!

``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTML Screen Reader Skip Link Implementation DESCRIPTION: Demonstrates how to implement a skip navigation link that is only visible to screen readers and keyboard focus, following web accessibility best practices. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/themes/docsy/assets/vendor/bootstrap/site/docs/4.1/utilities/screenreaders.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: html CODE: ``` Skip to main content ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example PromQL Expressions for SkyWalking Metrics DESCRIPTION: PromQL expressions to query service, service instance, and endpoint CPM (calls per minute) metrics in SkyWalking. These expressions demonstrate how to use labels to filter by service name, instance, endpoint, and layer. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2023-03-17-build-grafana-dashboards-for-apache-skywalking-native-promql-support/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` service_cpm{service='agent::songs', layer='GENERAL'} service_instance_cpm{service='agent::songs', service_instance='agent::songs_instance_1', layer='GENERAL'} endpoint_cpm{service='agent::songs', endpoint='GET:/songs', layer='GENERAL'} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring NGINX for SkyWalking AWS Firehose Receiver DESCRIPTION: This NGINX configuration sets up an HTTPS server to receive metrics streams from AWS and forward them to the SkyWalking aws-firehose-receiver. It listens on port 443, uses SSL certificates, and proxies requests to the OAP host. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2023-03-13-skywalking-aws-dynamodb/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: nginx CODE: ``` server { listen 443 ssl; ssl_certificate /crt/test.pem; ssl_certificate_key /crt/test.key; ssl_session_timeout 5m; ssl_ciphers ECDHE-RSA-AES128-GCM-SHA256:ECDHE:ECDH:AES:HIGH:!NULL:!aNULL:!MD5:!ADH:!RC4; ssl_protocols TLSv1 TLSv1.1 TLSv1.2; ssl_prefer_server_ciphers on; location /aws/firehose/metrics { proxy_pass http://test.xyz:12801/aws/firehose/metrics; } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing SkyWalking Plugin Interceptor in Java DESCRIPTION: This Java code defines the KobInterceptor class that implements the InstanceMethodsAroundInterceptor interface to trace method executions in the job scheduling framework. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2018-12-21-skywalking-apm-sniffer-beginning/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: Java CODE: ``` public class KobInterceptor implements InstanceMethodsAroundInterceptor { @Override public void beforeMethod(EnhancedInstance objInst, Method method, Object[] allArguments, Class[] argumentsTypes, MethodInterceptResult result) throws Throwable { final ContextCarrier contextCarrier = new ContextCarrier(); com.ke.kob.client.spring.model.TaskContext context = (TaskContext) allArguments[0]; CarrierItem next = contextCarrier.items(); while (next.hasNext()) { next = next.next(); next.setHeadValue(JSON.toJSONString(context.getUserParam())); } AbstractSpan span = ContextManager.createEntrySpan("client:"+allArguments[1]+",task:"+context.getTaskKey(), contextCarrier); span.setComponent(ComponentsDefine.TRANSPORT_CLIENT); SpanLayer.asRPCFramework(span); } @Override public Object afterMethod(EnhancedInstance objInst, Method method, Object[] allArguments, Class[] argumentsTypes, Object ret) throws Throwable { ContextManager.stopSpan(); return ret; } @Override public void handleMethodException(EnhancedInstance objInst, Method method, Object[] allArguments, Class[] argumentsTypes, Throwable t) { } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: SkyWalking IoTDB Storage Configuration in YAML DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration block for application.yml that specifies IoTDB as the storage backend for SkyWalking, including connection parameters like host, port, credentials, and performance settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2021-12-08-application-guide-of-iotdb-storage-option/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` storage: selector: ${SW_STORAGE:iotdb} iotdb: host: ${SW_STORAGE_IOTDB_HOST:127.0.0.1} rpcPort: ${SW_STORAGE_IOTDB_RPC_PORT:6667} username: ${SW_STORAGE_IOTDB_USERNAME:root} password: ${SW_STORAGE_IOTDB_PASSWORD:root} storageGroup: ${SW_STORAGE_IOTDB_STORAGE_GROUP:root.skywalking} sessionPoolSize: ${SW_STORAGE_IOTDB_SESSIONPOOL_SIZE:16} fetchTaskLogMaxSize: ${SW_STORAGE_IOTDB_FETCH_TASK_LOG_MAX_SIZE:1000} # the max number of fetch task log in a request ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: HTTP Server with SkyWalking Integration DESCRIPTION: Modified Go code that includes SkyWalking Go integration through package import. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2023-06-01-quick-start-with-skywalking-go-agent/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` package main import ( "net/http" // This is an important step. DON'T MISS IT. _ "github.com/apache/skywalking-go" ) func main() { http.HandleFunc("/hello", func(writer http.ResponseWriter, request *http.Request) { writer.Write([]byte("Hello World")) }) err := http.ListenAndServe(":8000", nil) if err != nil { panic(err) } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Docker Compose for ActiveMQ with JMX Exporter DESCRIPTION: This Docker Compose configuration sets up two ActiveMQ broker nodes with JMX Exporter running in agent mode, and two OpenTelemetry collectors. It defines network settings, volume mounts, port mappings, and environment variables required for monitoring. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2024-04-19-monitoring-activemq-through-skywalking/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yml CODE: ``` version: '3.8' services: amq1: image: apache/activemq-classic:latest container_name: amq1 hostname: amq1 volumes: - ~/activemq1/conf/activemq.xml:/opt/apache-activemq/conf/activemq.xml - ~/activemq1/bin/jmx_prometheus_javaagent-0.20.0.jar:/opt/apache-activemq/bin/jmx_prometheus_javaagent-0.20.0.jar - ~/activemq1/conf/config.yaml:/opt/apache-activemq/conf/config.yaml ports: - "61616:61616" - "8161:8161" - "2345:2345" environment: ACTIVEMQ_OPTS: "-javaagent:/opt/apache-activemq/bin/jmx_prometheus_javaagent-0.20.0.jar=2345:/opt/apache-activemq/conf/config.yaml" ACTIVEMQ_BROKER_NAME: broker-1 networks: - amqtest amq2: image: apache/activemq-classic:latest container_name: amq2 hostname: amq2 volumes: - ~/activemq2/conf/activemq.xml:/opt/apache-activemq/conf/activemq.xml - ~/activemq2/bin/jmx_prometheus_javaagent-0.20.0.jar:/opt/apache-activemq/bin/jmx_prometheus_javaagent-0.20.0.jar - ~/activemq2/conf/config.yaml:/opt/apache-activemq/conf/config.yaml ports: - "61617:61616" - "8162:8161" - "2346:2346" environment: ACTIVEMQ_OPTS: "-javaagent:/opt/apache-activemq/bin/jmx_prometheus_javaagent-0.20.0.jar=2346:/opt/apache-activemq/conf/config.yaml" ACTIVEMQ_BROKER_NAME: broker-2 networks: - amqtest otel-collector1: image: otel/opentelemetry-collector:latest container_name: otel-collector1 command: [ "--config=/etc/otel-collector-config.yaml" ] volumes: - ./otel-collector-config1.yaml:/etc/otel-collector-config.yaml depends_on: - amq1 networks: - amqtest otel-collector2: image: otel/opentelemetry-collector:latest container_name: otel-collector2 command: [ "--config=/etc/otel-collector-config.yaml" ] volumes: - ./otel-collector-config2.yaml:/etc/otel-collector-config.yaml depends_on: - amq2 networks: - amqtest networks: amqtest: ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OpenTelemetry Collector for ActiveMQ Monitoring DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration sets up OpenTelemetry Collector to scrape metrics from ActiveMQ's JMX Exporter endpoint and forward them to SkyWalking OAP. It defines the scrape target, interval, custom labels, and the processing pipeline. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2024-04-19-monitoring-activemq-through-skywalking/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` receivers: prometheus: config: scrape_configs: - job_name: 'activemq-monitoring' scrape_interval: 30s static_configs: - targets: ['amq1:2345'] labels: cluster: activemq-broker1 processors: batch: exporters: otlp: endpoint: oap:11800 tls: insecure: true service: pipelines: metrics: receivers: - prometheus processors: - batch exporters: - otlp ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: PromQL API Query for Services in a Specific Layer DESCRIPTION: HTTP GET request to the PromQL Service to retrieve all services in the GENERAL layer. This query includes a time range and uses the service_traffic metric. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2023-03-17-build-grafana-dashboards-for-apache-skywalking-native-promql-support/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_6 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` http://127.0.0.1:9099/api/v1/series?match[]=service_traffic{layer='GENERAL'}&start=1677479336&end=1677479636 ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Example Python Program for Profiling Demonstration DESCRIPTION: This code snippet shows a simple Python program with nested function calls used to demonstrate how profiling works in SkyWalking Python Agent. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2021-09-12-skywalking-python-profiling/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` def main(): methodA() def methodA(): methodB() def methodB(): methodC() methodD() def methodC(): time.sleep(0.04) def methodD(): time.sleep(0.06) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring JMX Exporter for ActiveMQ Metrics Collection DESCRIPTION: This YAML configuration for JMX Exporter defines which ActiveMQ JMX metrics to collect and expose as Prometheus-style metrics. It includes authentication settings, object name patterns to include/exclude, and transformation rules for the metrics. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2024-04-19-monitoring-activemq-through-skywalking/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` --- startDelaySeconds: 10 username: admin password: activemq ssl: false lowercaseOutputName: false lowercaseOutputLabelNames: false includeObjectNames: ["org.apache.activemq:*","java.lang:type=OperatingSystem","java.lang:type=GarbageCollector,*","java.lang:type=Threading","java.lang:type=Runtime","java.lang:type=Memory","java.lang:name=*"] excludeObjectNames: ["org.apache.activemq:type=ColumnFamily,*"] autoExcludeObjectNameAttributes: true excludeObjectNameAttributes: "java.lang:type=OperatingSystem": - "ObjectName" "java.lang:type=Runtime": - "ClassPath" - "SystemProperties" rules: - pattern: ".*" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OpenTelemetry Collector for AWS EKS Monitoring DESCRIPTION: This configuration sets up an OpenTelemetry collector to monitor AWS EKS. It uses the awscontainerinsightreceiver to collect metrics from EKS, adds a job_name attribute to identify the metrics in SkyWalking OAP, and exports the metrics via OTLP to the SkyWalking OAP service. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2023-03-12-skywalking-aws-s3-eks/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` extensions: health_check: receivers: awscontainerinsightreceiver: processors: # To enable OAP to correctly identify EKS metrics, add the job_name attribute resource/job-name: attributes: - key: job_name value: aws-cloud-eks-monitoring action: insert # Specify OAP as exporters exporters: otlp: endpoint: oap-service:11800 tls: insecure: true logging: loglevel: debug service: pipelines: metrics: receivers: [awscontainerinsightreceiver] processors: [resource/job-name] exporters: [otlp,logging] extensions: [health_check] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Form Groups with Bootstrap DESCRIPTION: This example shows how to use the form-group class to structure forms with proper grouping of labels, controls, and optional help text. It demonstrates the basic layout for text inputs with labels. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/themes/docsy/assets/vendor/bootstrap/site/docs/4.1/components/forms.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ```
``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Complete Kubernetes Configuration for EKS Monitoring with OpenTelemetry DESCRIPTION: This is a comprehensive Kubernetes configuration for monitoring AWS EKS with OpenTelemetry. It includes the required ServiceAccount, ClusterRole, ClusterRoleBinding, ConfigMap, and DaemonSet resources to deploy the AWS OpenTelemetry Collector in an EKS cluster. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2023-03-12-skywalking-aws-s3-eks/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: v1 kind: ServiceAccount metadata: name: aws-otel-sa namespace: aws-otel-eks --- kind: ClusterRole apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1 metadata: name: aoc-agent-role rules: - apiGroups: [""] resources: ["pods", "nodes", "endpoints"] verbs: ["list", "watch"] - apiGroups: ["apps"] resources: ["replicasets"] verbs: ["list", "watch"] - apiGroups: ["batch"] resources: ["jobs"] verbs: ["list", "watch"] - apiGroups: [""] resources: ["nodes/proxy"] verbs: ["get"] - apiGroups: [""] resources: ["nodes/stats", "configmaps", "events"] verbs: ["create", "get"] - apiGroups: [""] resources: ["configmaps"] resourceNames: ["otel-container-insight-clusterleader"] verbs: ["get","update"] - apiGroups: ["coordination.k8s.io"] resources: ["leases"] verbs: ["create","get","update"] --- kind: ClusterRoleBinding apiVersion: rbac.authorization.k8s.io/v1 metadata: name: aoc-agent-role-binding subjects: - kind: ServiceAccount name: aws-otel-sa namespace: aws-otel-eks roleRef: kind: ClusterRole name: aoc-agent-role apiGroup: rbac.authorization.k8s.io --- apiVersion: v1 kind: ConfigMap metadata: name: otel-agent-conf namespace: aws-otel-eks labels: app: opentelemetry component: otel-agent-conf data: otel-agent-config: | extensions: health_check: receivers: awscontainerinsightreceiver: processors: resource/job-name: attributes: - key: job_name value: aws-cloud-eks-monitoring action: insert exporters: otlp: endpoint: oap-service:11800 tls: insecure: true logging: loglevel: debug service: pipelines: metrics: receivers: [awscontainerinsightreceiver] processors: [resource/job-name] exporters: [otlp,logging] extensions: [health_check] --- apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: DaemonSet metadata: name: aws-otel-eks-ci namespace: aws-otel-eks spec: selector: matchLabels: name: aws-otel-eks-ci template: metadata: labels: name: aws-otel-eks-ci spec: containers: - name: aws-otel-collector image: amazon/aws-otel-collector:v0.23.0 env: # Specify region - name: AWS_REGION value: "ap-northeast-1" - name: K8S_NODE_NAME valueFrom: fieldRef: fieldPath: spec.nodeName - name: HOST_IP valueFrom: fieldRef: fieldPath: status.hostIP - name: HOST_NAME valueFrom: fieldRef: fieldPath: spec.nodeName - name: K8S_NAMESPACE valueFrom: fieldRef: fieldPath: metadata.namespace imagePullPolicy: Always command: - "/awscollector" - "--config=/conf/otel-agent-config.yaml" volumeMounts: - name: rootfs mountPath: /rootfs readOnly: true - name: dockersock mountPath: /var/run/docker.sock readOnly: true - name: varlibdocker mountPath: /var/lib/docker readOnly: true - name: containerdsock mountPath: /run/containerd/containerd.sock readOnly: true - name: sys mountPath: /sys readOnly: true - name: devdisk mountPath: /dev/disk readOnly: true - name: otel-agent-config-vol mountPath: /conf - name: otel-output-vol mountPath: /otel-output resources: limits: cpu: 200m memory: 200Mi requests: cpu: 200m memory: 200Mi volumes: - configMap: name: otel-agent-conf items: - key: otel-agent-config path: otel-agent-config.yaml name: otel-agent-config-vol - name: rootfs hostPath: path: / - name: dockersock hostPath: path: /var/run/docker.sock - name: varlibdocker hostPath: path: /var/lib/docker - name: containerdsock hostPath: path: /run/containerd/containerd.sock - name: sys hostPath: path: /sys - name: devdisk hostPath: path: /dev/disk/ - name: otel-output-vol hostPath: path: /otel-output serviceAccountName: aws-otel-sa ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: SkyWalking LAL Script for Error Log Processing DESCRIPTION: JSON configuration for a SkyWalking LAL script that uses regular expressions to parse and extract tags from the text-formatted error logs for better display and retrieval in SkyWalking. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2021-12-08-apisix-integrate-skywalking-plugin/apisix-integrate-skywalking-plugin.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: json CODE: ``` rules: - name: apisix-errlog dsl: | filter { text { regexp "(?\\d{4}/\\d{2}/\\d{2} \\d{2}:\\d{2}:\\d{2}) \\[(?\\w+)\\] \\d+\\#\\d+:( \\*\\d+ \\[(?\\w+)\\] (?.*\\.lua:\\d+): (?\\w+\\(\\)):)* (?.+)" } extractor { tag level: parsed.level if (parsed?.module) { tag module: parsed.module tag position: parsed.position tag function: parsed.function } } sink { } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring Fluent-bit for Nginx Log Collection DESCRIPTION: Configuration for Fluent-bit to collect and process Nginx access and error logs, forwarding them to SkyWalking OAP. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2023-12-23-monitoring-nginx-by-skywalking/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ini CODE: ``` [SERVICE] Flush 5 Daemon Off Log_Level warn [INPUT] Name tail Tag access Path /var/log/nginx/access.log [INPUT] Name tail Tag error Path /var/log/nginx/error.log [FILTER] Name lua Match access Script fluent-bit-script.lua Call rewrite_access_log [FILTER] Name lua Match error Script fluent-bit-script.lua Call rewrite_error_log [OUTPUT] Name stdout Match * Format json [OUTPUT] Name http Match * Host oap Port 12800 URI /v3/logs Format json ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring SkyWalking GRPC Appender in Logback XML DESCRIPTION: XML configuration for adding the SkyWalking GRPC appender to Logback. This appender sends log data to SkyWalking for analysis. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2024-05-09-skywalking-in-practice-s01e02/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` %d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS} [%X{tid}] [%thread] %-5level %logger{36} -%msg%n ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring ClickHouse Prometheus Endpoint DESCRIPTION: XML configuration for enabling Prometheus metrics endpoint in ClickHouse server. Sets up endpoint path, port, and metric collection options. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2024-03-12-monitoring-clickhouse-through-skywalking/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: xml CODE: ``` ...... /metrics 9363 true true true true ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring OpenTelemetry Collector DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for the OpenTelemetry Collector, specifying receivers, processors, and exporters for collecting and forwarding metrics to SkyWalking OAP Server. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2021-02-07-infrastructure-monitoring/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` extensions: health_check: receivers: prometheus: config: scrape_configs: - job_name: 'otel-collector' scrape_interval: 10s static_configs: - targets: [ 'vm1:9100' ] - targets: [ 'vm2:9100' ] - targets: [ 'vm3:9100' ] processors: batch: exporters: opencensus: endpoint: "docker.for.mac.host.internal:11800" insecure: true logging: logLevel: debug service: pipelines: metrics: receivers: [prometheus] processors: [batch] exporters: [logging, opencensus] extensions: [health_check] ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying SkyWalking Showcase with eBPF in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to deploy SkyWalking OAP, UI, and Rover in a Kubernetes environment. Sets environment variables for Docker images and feature flags before deploying with the make command. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2023-06-25-intruducing-continuous-profiling-skywalking-with-ebpf/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` export SW_OAP_IMAGE=apache/skywalking-oap-server:9.5.0 export SW_UI_IMAGE=apache/skywalking-ui:9.5.0 export SW_ROVER_IMAGE=apache/skywalking-rover:0.5.0 export FEATURE_FLAGS=mesh-with-agent,single-node,elasticsearch,rover make deploy.kubernetes ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Spring Cloud Gateway Deployment Configuration DESCRIPTION: Kubernetes deployment configuration for Spring Cloud Gateway application with SkyWalking agent injection and gateway-specific plugin settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2022-04-19-How-to-use-the-java-agent-injector/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_13 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: Deployment metadata: labels: app: demo-gateway name: demo-gateway namespace: gateway-system spec: selector: matchLabels: app: demo-gateway template: metadata: labels: swck-java-agent-injected: "true" app: demo-gateway annotations: strategy.skywalking.apache.org/agent.Overlay: "true" agent.skywalking.apache.org/agent.service_name: "gateway-service" optional.skywalking.apache.org: "cloud-gateway-3.x" # add spring cloud gateway plugin spec: containers: - image: gateway:v0.0.1 name: gateway command: ["java"] args: ["-jar","/gateway.jar"] --- apiVersion: v1 kind: Service metadata: name: service-gateway namespace: gateway-system spec: type: ClusterIP ports: - name: 9999-tcp port: 9999 protocol: TCP targetPort: 9999 selector: app: demo-gateway ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Building and Running Provider Service with SkyWalking Go Agent DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to build and run the provider service with SkyWalking Go Agent. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2023-10-18-skywalking-toolkit-trace/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` go build -toolexec="/path/to/go-agent" -a -o provider ./provider.go ./provider ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Kernel Function Monitoring Points for Network Traffic DESCRIPTION: List of kernel functions monitored by SkyWalking Rover to track packet transmission from Layer 4 to Layer 2, including TCP operations, IP routing, and network interface interactions SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2024-03-18-monitor-kubernetes-network-by-ebpf/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` kprobe/tcp_sendmsg kprobe/tcp_transmit_skb tracepoint/tcp/tcp_retransmit_skb tracepoint/skb/kfree_skb kprobe/__ip_queue_xmit kprobe/nf_hook_slow kprobe/neigh_resolve_output kprobe/__dev_queue_xmit tracepoint/net/net_dev_start_xmit tracepoint/net/net_dev_xmit ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Spring Boot Deployment Configuration DESCRIPTION: Kubernetes deployment configuration for Spring Boot application with SkyWalking agent injection settings and service definition. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2022-04-19-How-to-use-the-java-agent-injector/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_12 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` apiVersion: apps/v1 kind: Deployment metadata: name: demo-springboot namespace: springboot-system spec: selector: matchLabels: app: demo-springboot template: metadata: labels: swck-java-agent-injected: "true" # enable the java agent injector app: demo-springboot annotations: strategy.skywalking.apache.org/agent.Overlay: "true" # enable the agent overlay agent.skywalking.apache.org/agent.service_name: "backend-service" spec: containers: - name: springboot imagePullPolicy: IfNotPresent image: app:v0.0.1 command: ["java"] args: ["-jar","/app.jar"] --- apiVersion: v1 kind: Service metadata: name: demo namespace: springboot-system spec: type: ClusterIP ports: - name: 8085-tcp port: 8085 protocol: TCP targetPort: 8085 selector: app: demo-springboot ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Chaining Bootstrap Plugin Methods in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This example demonstrates chaining Bootstrap plugin methods and jQuery methods in a single statement. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/themes/docsy/assets/vendor/bootstrap/site/docs/4.1/getting-started/javascript.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` $('.btn.danger').button('toggle').addClass('fat') ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Modal Focus JavaScript Event Handler DESCRIPTION: JavaScript code to handle autofocus functionality in Bootstrap modals since HTML5 autofocus attribute doesn't work in modals. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/themes/docsy/assets/vendor/bootstrap/site/docs/4.1/components/modal.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` $('#myModal').on('shown.bs.modal', function () { $('#myInput').trigger('focus') }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Deploying SkyWalking Kubernetes Event Exporter DESCRIPTION: Command to deploy the SkyWalking Kubernetes Event Exporter using a YAML configuration file, which enables watching, filtering, and sending Kubernetes events to the SkyWalking backend. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2024-05-09-skywalking-in-practice-s01e02/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` rules: - name: default layer: GENERAL dsl: | filter { text { abortOnFailure false regexp $/(?\d{4}-\d{2}-\d{2} \d{2}:\d{2}:\d{2}\.\d{3}) \[.+] \[.+] (?\w+) (?.*)/$ } extractor { tag level: parsed.level timestamp parsed.time as String, "yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss.SSS" if (parsed.level == "ERROR") { metrics { timestamp log.timestamp as Long labels service: log.service, service_instance_id: log.serviceInstance name "log_exception_count" value 1 } } } sink { } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Port Forwarding SkyWalking UI in Kubernetes DESCRIPTION: This command sets up port forwarding to access the SkyWalking UI locally on port 8080 after deployment. This updates the global configuration for all agents. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2022-04-19-How-to-use-the-java-agent-injector/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_10 LANGUAGE: sh CODE: ``` $ kubectl edit configmap skywalking-swck-java-agent-configmap -n skywalking-swck-system configmap/skywalking-swck-java-agent-configmap edited $ kubectl get configmap skywalking-swck-java-agent-configmap -n skywalking-swck-system -oyaml apiVersion: v1 data: agent.config: |- # The service name in UI agent.service_name=${SW_AGENT_NAME:Your_ApplicationName} # Backend service addresses. collector.backend_service=${SW_AGENT_COLLECTOR_BACKEND_SERVICES:default-oap.default:11800} # Please refer to https://skywalking.apache.org/docs/skywalking-java/latest/en/setup/service-agent/java-agent/configurations/#table-of-agent-configuration-properties to get more details. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Manual Tracing in Provider Service DESCRIPTION: Go code demonstrating manual tracing implementation in a provider HTTP service using SkyWalking Go Toolkit Trace. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2023-10-18-skywalking-toolkit-trace/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` // provider.go package main import ( "net/http" _ "github.com/apache/skywalking-go" "github.com/apache/skywalking-go/toolkit/trace" ) func providerHandler(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) { //Create an EntrySpan to trace the execution of the providerHandler method. trace.CreateEntrySpan("GET:/provider", func(headerKey string) (string, error) { return r.Header.Get(headerKey), nil }) // Finish the EntrySpan. defer trace.StopSpan() _, _ = w.Write([]byte("success from provider")) } func main() { http.HandleFunc("/provider", providerHandler) _ = http.ListenAndServe(":9998", nil) } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating a Complex Card with Multiple Content Types in HTML DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates a complex card layout with an image, title, text, list group, and links. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2023-10-18-skywalking-toolkit-trace/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_8 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` spanRef, err := trace.CreateLocalSpan("LocalSpan") if err != nil { return } spanRef.PrepareAsync() go func(){ // some work spanRef.AsyncFinish() }() // some work trace.StopSpan() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Defining Log-MAL Rules for Metric Analysis DESCRIPTION: YAML configuration for SkyWalking Log-MAL rules to analyze the log_exception_count metric, calculating the sum of exceptions per minute. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2024-05-09-skywalking-in-practice-s01e02/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` metricPrefix: instance metricsRules: - name: log_exception_count exp: log_exception_count.sum(['service','service_instance_id']).downsampling(SUM).instance(['service'], ['service_instance_id'], Layer.GENERAL) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing SkyWalking Middleware for Gin in Go DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to create a middleware for the Gin web framework in Go to integrate SkyWalking tracing. It creates an EntrySpan for incoming requests and sets the span context in the request. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2022-04-13-skywalking-in-autonomous-driving/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` func Middleware(engine *gin.Engine, tracer *go2sky.Tracer) gin.HandlerFunc { return func(c *gin.Context) { span, ctx, err := tracer.CreateEntrySpan(c.Request.Context(), getOperationName(c), func(key string) (string, error) { return c.Request.Header.Get(key), nil }) // some operation c.Request = c.Request.WithContext(ctx) c.Next() span.End() } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting OpenTelemetry Collector with Docker Compose DESCRIPTION: Command to start the OpenTelemetry Collector container using Docker Compose. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2021-09-12-skywalking-python-profiling/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Python CODE: ``` import time def method1(): time.sleep(0.02) return '1' def method2(): time.sleep(0.02) return method1() def method3(): time.sleep(0.02) return method2() if __name__ == '__main__': import socketserver from http.server import BaseHTTPRequestHandler class SimpleHTTPRequestHandler(BaseHTTPRequestHandler): def do_POST(self): method3() time.sleep(0.5) self.send_response(200) self.send_header('Content-Type', 'application/json') self.end_headers() self.wfile.write('{"song": "Despacito", "artist": "Luis Fonsi"}'.encode('ascii')) PORT = 19090 Handler = SimpleHTTPRequestHandler with socketserver.TCPServer(("", PORT), Handler) as httpd: httpd.serve_forever() ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring SkyWalking OAP Server for VM Monitoring DESCRIPTION: Environment variable settings to activate the OpenCensus handler and VM monitoring rules in SkyWalking OAP Server. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/themes/docsy/assets/vendor/bootstrap/js/tests/README.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` // Asynchronous test QUnit.test('should describe the unit being tested', function (assert) { assert.expect(2) var done = assert.async() var $tooltip = $('
').bootstrapTooltip() var tooltipInstance = $tooltip.data('bs.tooltip') var spyShow = sinon.spy(tooltipInstance, 'show') $tooltip.appendTo('#qunit-fixture') .on('shown.bs.tooltip', function () { assert.ok(true, '"shown" event was fired after calling "show"') assert.ok(spyShow.called, 'show called') done() }) .bootstrapTooltip('show') }) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing SkyWalking Go Toolkit Trace DESCRIPTION: Go code snippet showing how to import the SkyWalking Go Toolkit Trace package. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Installing Istio and Configuring Envoy ALS DESCRIPTION: Shell commands to install Istio, configure Envoy Access Log Service (ALS), and enable Envoy proxy injection in the default namespace. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2022-01-24-scaling-with-apache-skywalking/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` # install istioctl export ISTIO_VERSION=1.12.0 curl -L https://istio.io/downloadIstio | sh - sudo mv $PWD/istio-$ISTIO_VERSION/bin/istioctl /usr/local/bin/ # install istio istioctl install -y --set profile=demo \ --set meshConfig.enableEnvoyAccessLogService=true \ --set meshConfig.defaultConfig.envoyAccessLogService.address=skywalking-system-satellite.skywalking-system:11800 # enbale envoy proxy in default namespace kubectl label namespace default istio-injection=enabled ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring AWS IAM, S3, and Kinesis Firehose for CloudWatch Metric Streaming in Terraform DESCRIPTION: This Terraform configuration sets up the necessary AWS resources for streaming CloudWatch metrics. It creates IAM roles and policies, an S3 bucket, and a Kinesis Firehose delivery stream. The stream is configured to send data to an HTTP endpoint (SkyWalking gateway) with S3 as a backup. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2023-03-13-skywalking-aws-dynamodb/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: HCL CODE: ``` # https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/CloudWatch-metric-streams-trustpolicy.html data "aws_iam_policy_document" "metric_stream_to_firehose" { statement { effect = "Allow" actions = [ "firehose:PutRecord", "firehose:PutRecordBatch", ] resources = [aws_kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.http_stream.arn] } } resource "aws_iam_role_policy" "metric_stream_to_firehose" { name = "default" role = aws_iam_role.metric_stream_to_firehose.id policy = data.aws_iam_policy_document.metric_stream_to_firehose.json } resource "aws_s3_bucket" "bucket" { bucket = "metric-stream-test-bucket" } resource "aws_s3_bucket_acl" "bucket_acl" { bucket = aws_s3_bucket.bucket.id acl = "private" } data "aws_iam_policy_document" "firehose_assume_role" { statement { effect = "Allow" principals { type = "Service" identifiers = ["firehose.amazonaws.com"] } actions = ["sts:AssumeRole"] } } resource "aws_iam_role" "firehose_to_s3" { assume_role_policy = data.aws_iam_policy_document.firehose_assume_role.json } data "aws_iam_policy_document" "firehose_to_s3" { statement { effect = "Allow" actions = [ "s3:AbortMultipartUpload", "s3:GetBucketLocation", "s3:GetObject", "s3:ListBucket", "s3:ListBucketMultipartUploads", "s3:PutObject", ] resources = [ aws_s3_bucket.bucket.arn, "${aws_s3_bucket.bucket.arn}/*", ] } } resource "aws_iam_role_policy" "firehose_to_s3" { name = "default" role = aws_iam_role.firehose_to_s3.id policy = data.aws_iam_policy_document.firehose_to_s3.json } resource "aws_kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream" "http_stream" { name = "metric-stream-test-stream" destination = "http_endpoint" http_endpoint_configuration { name = "test_http_endpoint" url = "Gatewayurl" role_arn = aws_iam_role.firehose_to_s3.arn } s3_configuration { role_arn = aws_iam_role.firehose_to_s3.arn bucket_arn = aws_s3_bucket.bucket.arn } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Responsive Typography with SCSS SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2024-12-09-skywalking-async-profiler/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` | Task sample type | JFR event type | Description | Unit | | :------------------------------------------ | :----------------------------------------------------------- | :----------------------------------------------------------- | :----------------------------------------------------------- | | CPU
WALL

ITIMER
CTIMER | EXECUTION\_SAMPLE | Multiple **AsyncProfilerEventType** types correspond to the **EXECUTION_SAMPLE** event. This is primarily due to the fact that different sampling types employ distinct underlying mechanisms and have varying sampling scopes. | Sample times.
The execution time can be calculated based on the sampling interval. For instance, if the number of samples is 10 and the interval is set to 10ms, the total execution time can be estimated as 100ms (the default interval is 10ms) | | LOCK | THREAD\_PARK
JAVA\_MONITOR\_ENTER | Empty | ns | | ALLOC | OBJECT\_ALLOCATION\_IN\_NEW\_TLAB
OBJECT\_ALLOCATION\_OUTSIDE\_TLAB | Empty | byte | | Add `live` option to extended parameters | PROFILER\_LIVE\_OBJECT | Because it is not in the event parameter of async-profiler, it is not selected separately in the task sampling type of the UI during implementation, but is used as an extended parameter | byte | ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Querying Service Names for Layer Variable in Grafana Dashboard DESCRIPTION: PromQL query expression used in a Grafana dashboard variable to retrieve all service names under a specific layer. It modifies the publish function of the paho.mqtt.client to create ExitSpans and inject context into the MQTT payload. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2022-04-13-skywalking-in-autonomous-driving/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` def install(): from paho.mqtt.client import Client _publish = Client.publish Client.publish = _sw_publish_func(_publish) def _sw_publish_func(_publish): def _sw_publish(this, topic, payload=None, qos=0, retain=False, properties=None): # some operation with get_context().new_exit_span(op="EMQX/Topic/" + topic + "/Producer" or "/", peer=peer) as span: carrier = span.inject() span.layer = Layer.MQ span.component = Component.RabbitmqProducer payload = {} if payload is None else json.loads(payload) payload['headers'] = {} for item in carrier: payload['headers'][item.key] = item.val # ... return _sw_publish ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring NGE2E Test Case with YAML DESCRIPTION: Example of an e2e.yaml configuration file defining setup, trigger, and verification steps for an NGE2E test case using KinD environment. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/e2e-design/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` setup: env: kind file: kind.yaml manifests: - path: bookinfo.yaml wait: # you can have multiple conditions to wait - namespace: bookinfo label-selector: app=product for: deployment/available - namespace: reviews label-selector: app=product for: deployment/available - namespace: ratings label-selector: app=product for: deployment/available run: - command: | # it can be a shell script or anything executable istioctl install --profile=demo -y kubectl label namespace default istio-injection=enabled wait: - namespace: istio-system label-selector: app=istiod for: deployment/available # OR # env: compose # file: docker-compose.yaml trigger: action: http interval: 3s times: 0 url: localhost:9090/users verify: - query: swctl service ls expected: expected.services.yaml - query: swctl endpoint ls --service="YnVzaW5lc3Mtem9uZTo6cHJvamVjdEM=.1" expected: expected.projectC.endpoints.yaml ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Route with SkyWalking Tracing and Logging Plugins DESCRIPTION: Shell command using curl to create an APISIX route and bind it with the SkyWalking Tracing plugin and SkyWalking Logging plugin, pointing to httpbin.org as the upstream service. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2021-12-08-apisix-integrate-skywalking-plugin/apisix-integrate-skywalking-plugin.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` curl -X PUT 'http://192.168.0.108:9080/apisix/admin/routes/1001' \ -H 'X-API-KEY: edd1c9f034335f136f87ad84b625c8f1' \ -H 'Content-Type: application/json' \ -d '{ "uri": "/get", "plugins": { "skywalking": { "sample_ratio": 1 }, "skywalking-logger": { "endpoint_addr": "http://127.0.0.1:12800" } }, "upstream": { "type": "roundrobin", "nodes": { "httpbin.org:80": 1 } } }' ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Demonstrating Offset Classes in Bootstrap Grid (HTML) DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to use offset classes to move columns to the right in Bootstrap's grid system. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2018-12-21-skywalking-apm-sniffer-beginning/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: Java CODE: ``` public class AgentMain { public static void premain(String agentOps, Instrumentation instrumentation) { new AgentBuilder.Default() .type(ElementMatchers.named("org.springframework.web.servlet.DispatcherServlet")) .transform((builder, type, classLoader, module) -> builder.method(ElementMatchers.named("doDispatch")) .intercept(MethodDelegation.to(DoDispatchInterceptor.class))) .installOn(instrumentation); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Enabling and Configuring SkyWalking Error Logger Plugin DESCRIPTION: Shell command using curl to configure the error-log-logger plugin metadata to send error logs to SkyWalking OAP Server with specific log level and timeout settings. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/events/release-apache-skywalking-apm-9.4.0/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` // When // (1) the time bucket of the server's latest stability status is provided // 1.1 the OAP has booted successfully // 1.2 the current dimensionality is in minute. // 1.3 the OAP cluster is rebalanced due to scaling // (2) the metrics are from the time after the timeOfLatestStabilitySts // (3) the metrics don't exist in the cache // the kernel should NOT try to load it from the database. // // Notice, about condition (2), // for the specific minute of booted successfully, the metrics are expected to load from database when // it doesn't exist in the cache. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying Istio Sidecar Installation DESCRIPTION: Sample log output showing successful installation and initialization of Istio sidecar proxy on VM instances. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2025-03-06-introduction-to-skywalking-ruby/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_7 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` module Skywalking module Plugins class Redis5 < PluginsManager::SWPlugin module Redis5Intercept def call_v(args, &block) operation = args[0] rescue "UNKNOWN" return super if operation == :auth Tracing::ContextManager.new_exit_span( operation: "Redis/#{operation.upcase}" ) do |span| # Omitted handling of span super(args, &block) # Call the original method end end end def install ::Redis::Client.prepend Redis5Intercept end end end end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Using Max-width Utility in HTML DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to apply the max-width: 100% utility class (mw-100) to an image element. It demonstrates how to create and increment a counter metric. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2024-10-20-skywalking-go-toolkit-metrics-log/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` package main import ( "log" "net/http" _ "github.com/apache/skywalking-go" "github.com/apache/skywalking-go/toolkit/metric" ) func main() { // Create a Counter type metric // We also set labels for this Counter counter := metric.NewCounter( "http_request_count", metric.WithLabels("path", "/ping"), ) http.HandleFunc("/ping", func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) { // Increment the count by one for each incoming request counter.Inc(1) w.WriteHeader(http.StatusOK) }) if err := http.ListenAndServe(":8080", nil); err != nil { log.Fatalln("server running by err:", err) } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Importing Partial Bootstrap 4 in Sass DESCRIPTION: Shows how to selectively import parts of Bootstrap, including required and optional components. SkyWalking Team

The SkyWalking team is comprised of Members and Contributors, and the growth has never stopped. Members have direct access to the source of SkyWalking project and actively evolve the code-base. Contributors improve the project through submission of patches and suggestions to the Members.

SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/themes/docsy/userguide/content/en/docs/Getting started/_index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: bash CODE: ``` sudo install hugo /usr/bin ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Logging in a Go Web Service DESCRIPTION: Example of a Go web service that uses SkyWalking toolkit for logging. It demonstrates how to log errors and attach them to the current span. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2024-10-20-skywalking-go-toolkit-metrics-log/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: go CODE: ``` package main import ( "log" "net/http" _ "github.com/apache/skywalking-go" "github.com/apache/skywalking-go/toolkit/logging" ) func main() { http.HandleFunc("/user", func(w http.ResponseWriter, r *http.Request) { userName := r.URL.Query().Get("userName") if len(userName) == 0 || userName != "root" { // Log an entry, which will be attached to the currently active Span in the context. // We can append log tags using variadic parameters. logging.Error("deny user login", "userName", userName) w.WriteHeader(http.StatusUnauthorized) return } w.WriteHeader(http.StatusAccepted) }) if err := http.ListenAndServe(":8080", nil); err != nil { log.Fatalln("server running by err:", err) } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Resolving Namespace Conflicts for Bootstrap Plugins in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This snippet demonstrates how to use the noConflict method to resolve namespace conflicts when using Bootstrap plugins with other UI frameworks. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2021-02-01-e2e-verifier-design/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: yaml CODE: ``` # expected.data.yaml nodes: - id: {{ b64enc "User" }}.0 name: User type: USER isReal: false - id: {{ b64enc "Your_ApplicationName" }}.1 name: Your_ApplicationName type: Tomcat isReal: true - id: {{ $h2ID := (index .nodes 2).id }}{{ notEmpty $h2ID }} # We assert that nodes[2].id is not empty and save it to variable `h2ID` for later use name: localhost:-1 type: H2 isReal: false calls: - id: {{ notEmpty (index .calls 0).id }} source: {{ b64enc "Your_ApplicationName" }}.1 target: {{ $h2ID }} # We use the previously assigned variable `h2Id` to asert that the `target` is equal to the `id` of the nodes[2] detectPoints: - CLIENT - id: {{ b64enc "User" }}.0-{{ b64enc "Your_ApplicationName" }}.1 source: {{ b64enc "User" }}.0 target: {{ b64enc "Your_ApplicationName" }}.1 detectPoints: - SERVER ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Bootstrap Popovers on Disabled Elements DESCRIPTION: This HTML example shows how to create a popover on a disabled button by wrapping it in a span and using custom styles. It provides methods to produce and consume commands for different service and instance combinations. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2023-09-17-integrating-skywalking-with-arthas/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_4 LANGUAGE: Java CODE: ``` public class CommandQueue { private static final Map COMMANDS = new ConcurrentHashMap<>(); // produce by connectdisconnect public static void produceCommand(String serviceName, String instanceName, Command command) { COMMANDS.put(serviceName + instanceName, command); } // consume by agent getCommand task public static Optional consumeCommand(String serviceName, String instanceName) { return Optional.ofNullable(COMMANDS.remove(serviceName + instanceName)); } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Multiple Targets Collapse Example in HTML DESCRIPTION: HTML implementation for collapse components with multiple triggers controlling separate or shared collapsible elements. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2023-09-17-integrating-skywalking-with-arthas/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: Java CODE: ``` Server .builder() .port(port, SessionProtocol.HTTP) .service("/arthas", oap) .service("/graphql", oap) .service("/internal/l7check", HealthCheckService.of()) .service("/zipkin/config.json", zipkin) .serviceUnder("/zipkin/api", zipkin) .serviceUnder("/zipkin", FileService.of( ApplicationStartUp.class.getClassLoader(), "/zipkin-lens") .orElse(zipkinIndexPage)) .serviceUnder("/", FileService.of( ApplicationStartUp.class.getClassLoader(), "/public") .orElse(indexPage)) .build() .start() .join(); ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Including Accessibility Warning Callout with Liquid Templates DESCRIPTION: A Liquid template snippet that captures content for an accessibility warning and includes it in a callout component. It warns developers about using color alone to convey meaning and suggests alternative approaches for assistive technology users. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/themes/docsy/assets/vendor/bootstrap/site/_includes/callout-warning-color-assistive-technologies.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: liquid CODE: ``` {% capture callout %} ##### Conveying meaning to assistive technologies Using color to add meaning only provides a visual indication, which will not be conveyed to users of assistive technologies such as screen readers. Ensure that information denoted by the color is either obvious from the content itself (e.g. the visible text), or is included through alternative means, such as additional text hidden with the `.sr-only` class. {% endcapture %} {% include callout.html content=callout type="warning" %} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Simulating Exception in Java Service DESCRIPTION: Java method that simulates an exception by dividing by zero, scheduled to run every second. This generates a java.lang.ArithmeticException in the service logs. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2024-05-09-skywalking-in-practice-s01e02/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: java CODE: ``` @Scheduled(fixedDelay = 1000) public void mockException() throws Exception { int i = 1 / 0; } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Integrating SkyWalking in Sinatra Projects DESCRIPTION: Example of how to manually integrate SkyWalking in a Sinatra project by calling Skywalking.start at application startup. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/2025-03-06-introduction-to-skywalking-ruby/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: ruby CODE: ``` require 'sinatra' require 'skywalking' Skywalking.start get '/sw' do "Hello SkyWalking!" end ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Liquid Template with Callout Component for Media Query Documentation DESCRIPTION: A Liquid template snippet that creates a callout component to display information about CSS media query limitations in browsers and the implemented workarounds for handling viewports with fractional widths. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/themes/docsy/assets/vendor/bootstrap/site/_includes/callout-info-mediaqueries-breakpoints.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: liquid CODE: ``` {% capture callout %} Note that since browsers do not currently support [range context queries](https://www.w3.org/TR/mediaqueries-4/#range-context), we work around the limitations of [`min-` and `max-` prefixes](https://www.w3.org/TR/mediaqueries-4/#mq-min-max) and viewports with fractional widths (which can occur under certain conditions on high-dpi devices, for instance) by using values with higher precision for these comparisons. {% endcapture %} {% include callout.html content=callout type="info" %} ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing Bootstrap List Group Tabs with Data Attributes DESCRIPTION: HTML structure for creating tabbable content using Bootstrap list groups with data attributes, eliminating the need for custom JavaScript. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Configuring AWS Services with Terraform DESCRIPTION: This Terraform configuration sets up a DynamoDB table, CloudWatch metric stream, and necessary IAM roles. It creates a DynamoDB table named 'GameScores' and configures a metric stream to send DynamoDB metrics to a Kinesis Firehose delivery stream. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2023-03-13-skywalking-aws-dynamodb/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_2 LANGUAGE: hcl CODE: ``` provider "aws" { region = "ap-northeast-1" access_key = "access_key" secret_key = "secret_key" } resource "aws_dynamodb_table" "basic-dynamodb-table" { name = "GameScores" billing_mode = "PROVISIONED" read_capacity = 20 write_capacity = 20 hash_key = "UserId" range_key = "GameTitle" attribute { name = "UserId" type = "S" } attribute { name = "GameTitle" type = "S" } attribute { name = "TopScore" type = "N" } ttl { attribute_name = "TimeToExist" enabled = true } global_secondary_index { name = "GameTitleIndex" hash_key = "GameTitle" range_key = "TopScore" write_capacity = 10 read_capacity = 10 projection_type = "INCLUDE" non_key_attributes = ["UserId"] } tags = { Name = "dynamodb-table-1" Environment = "production" } } resource "aws_cloudwatch_metric_stream" "main" { name = "my-metric-stream" role_arn = aws_iam_role.metric_stream_to_firehose.arn firehose_arn = aws_kinesis_firehose_delivery_stream.http_stream.arn output_format = "opentelemetry0.7" include_filter { namespace = "AWS/DynamoDB" } } # https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonCloudWatch/latest/monitoring/CloudWatch-metric-streams-trustpolicy.html data "aws_iam_policy_document" "streams_assume_role" { statement { effect = "Allow" principals { type = "Service" identifiers = ["streams.metrics.cloudwatch.amazonaws.com"] } actions = ["sts:AssumeRole"] } } resource "aws_iam_role" "metric_stream_to_firehose" { name = "metric_stream_to_firehose_role" assume_role_policy = data.aws_iam_policy_document.streams_assume_role.json } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Accessing Bootstrap Plugin Version in JavaScript DESCRIPTION: This code shows how to access the version number of a Bootstrap jQuery plugin using the VERSION property of the plugin's constructor. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/themes/docsy/assets/vendor/bootstrap/site/docs/4.1/getting-started/javascript.md#2025-04-09_snippet_9 LANGUAGE: javascript CODE: ``` $.fn.tooltip.Constructor.VERSION // => "{{ site.current_version }}" ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Verifying Test Outputs with NGE2E DESCRIPTION: Commands for verifying test outputs by comparing actual results with expected data or running queries to fetch and compare data. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/blog/e2e-design/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_3 LANGUAGE: shell CODE: ``` e2e verify --actual=actual.data.yaml --expected=expected.data.yaml e2e verify --query="swctl service ls" --expected=expected.data.yaml e2e verify # If configuration file e2e.yaml is present ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Button Element Types DESCRIPTION: Shows different HTML elements that can be styled as buttons using Bootstrap classes SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/themes/docsy/assets/vendor/bootstrap/site/docs/4.1/components/buttons.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: HTML CODE: ``` Link ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Relative Markdown Link Example DESCRIPTION: Example of a hardcoded relative link in Markdown format that might behave unexpectedly in Hugo SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/themes/docsy/userguide/content/en/docs/Best practices/site-guidance.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: markdown CODE: ``` [relative cross-link](../../peer-folder/sub-file.md) ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing SwaggerUI in Hugo with Docsy DESCRIPTION: Renders Swagger UI using OpenAPI YAML or JSON file as source for API documentation. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/themes/docsy/assets/vendor/bootstrap/site/docs/4.1/getting-started/theming.md#2025-04-09_snippet_14 LANGUAGE: scss CODE: ``` @each $breakpoint in map-keys($grid-breakpoints) { @include media-breakpoint-up($breakpoint) { $infix: breakpoint-infix($breakpoint, $grid-breakpoints); .text#{$infix}-left { text-align: left !important; } .text#{$infix}-right { text-align: right !important; } .text#{$infix}-center { text-align: center !important; } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Explaining Sharding Key Concept in BanyanDB DESCRIPTION: Documentation explaining how sharding keys are used to group time series data per metric of entities in BanyanDB storage implementation. Includes example of how service traffic metrics are sharded by service ID. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/events/release-apache-skywalking-apm-9.0.0/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_0 LANGUAGE: text CODE: ``` Sharding key is used to group time series data per metric of one entity in one place (same sharding and/or same row for column-oriented database). For example, ServiceA's traffic gauge, service call per minute, includes following timestamp values, then it should be sharded by service ID [ServiceA(encoded ID): 01-28 18:30 values-1, 01-28 18:31 values-2, 01-28 18:32 values-3, 01-28 18:32 values-4] BanyanDB is the 1st storage implementation supporting this. It would make continuous time series metrics stored closely and compressed better. NOTICE, this sharding concept is NOT just for splitting data into different database instances or physical files. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Removing Breadcrumb Separator in SCSS DESCRIPTION: This SCSS snippet shows how to remove the separator in breadcrumb navigation by setting the $breadcrumb-divider variable to none. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing DispatcherServlet Interceptor in Java DESCRIPTION: This code defines the DoDispatchInterceptor class that intercepts the doDispatch method, logging request details and execution time. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2018-12-21-skywalking-apm-sniffer-beginning/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_1 LANGUAGE: Java CODE: ``` public class DoDispatchInterceptor { @RuntimeType public static Object intercept(@Argument(0) HttpServletRequest request, @SuperCall Callable callable) { final StringBuilder in = new StringBuilder(); if (request.getParameterMap() != null && request.getParameterMap().size() > 0) { request.getParameterMap().keySet().forEach(key -> in.append("key=" + key + "_value=" + request.getParameter(key) + ",")); } long agentStart = System.currentTimeMillis(); try { return callable.call(); } catch (Exception e) { System.out.println("Exception :" + e.getMessage()); return null; } finally { System.out.println("path:" + request.getRequestURI() + " :" + in + " :" + (System.currentTimeMillis() - agentStart)); } } } ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Starting Ruby Application with SkyWalking Environment Variable DESCRIPTION: Example of how to set the SkyWalking service name environment variable before starting a Ruby application to customize the service name in SkyWalking. ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Implementing SkyWalking Plugin for Python Requests DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to create a SkyWalking plugin for the Python Requests library. It replaces the original request function with a custom one that creates ExitSpans and injects context into request headers. SOURCE: https://github.com/apache/skywalking-website/blob/master/content/zh/2022-04-13-skywalking-in-autonomous-driving/index.md#2025-04-09_snippet_5 LANGUAGE: python CODE: ``` def install(): from requests import Session _request = Session.request def _sw_request(this: Session, method, url, other params...): span = get_context().new_exit_span(op=url_param.path or '/', peer=url_param.netloc, component=Component.Requests) with span: carrier = span.inject() span.layer = Layer.Http if headers is None: headers = {} for item in carrier: headers[item.key] = item.val span.tag(TagHttpMethod(method.upper())) span.tag(TagHttpURL(url_param.geturl())) res = _request(this, method, url, , other params...n) # some operation return res Session.request = _sw_request ``` ---------------------------------------- TITLE: Creating Right-Aligned Dropdown Menus in Bootstrap DESCRIPTION: Example of right-aligning dropdown menus using the .dropdown-menu-right class, which positions the menu to the right side of its parent element.
